Package group2.monopoly.auth.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
group2.monopoly.auth.controller.AuthController
@RestController @RequestMapping(value="/api/auth", produces="application/json", consumes="application/json") public class AuthController extends Object
Controller for mapping authentication related endpoints.

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUser

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> authenticateUser(@Validated(CustomGroupSequence.class) @RequestBody LoginDto loginDto)
      Tries to authenticate the supplied credentials.
      Parameters:
      loginDto - Validated LoginDto object
      Returns:
      Response with JSON body containing the JWT token
      See Also:
      • LoginDto

    • registerUser

      @PostMapping("/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> registerUser(@Validated(CustomGroupSequence.class) @RequestBody SignUpDto signUpDto) throws BasicAuthException
      Registers a new user.

      The DTO fields are validated with the validators specified in SignUpDto.
      Parameters:
      signUpDto - validated SignUpDto object
      Returns:
      A response entity with either the created user or error description
      Throws:
      BasicAuthException

    • forgotPassword

      @PostMapping("/forgotPassword") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.node.ObjectNode> forgotPassword(@RequestBody @NonNull @NonNull com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode identifier) throws BasicAuthException
      Given a username or email, sends a password reset token to the account owner's email.

      This endpoint responds the same regardless of whether the requested account exists. This is done to prevent account enumeration by abusing this endpoint.
      Parameters:
      identifier - Username or email of the user
      Returns:
      JSON response notifying a password reset token is sent if such user exists
      Throws:
      BasicAuthException

    • resetPassword

      @PostMapping("/resetPassword") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> resetPassword(@Validated(CustomGroupSequence.class) @RequestBody PasswordResetRequestDTO passwordResetRequestDTO) throws BasicAuthException
      Resets the password of the account associated with the provided password reset token.

      For the password change to be successful provided new passwords should match and meet the password requirements.
      Parameters:
      passwordResetRequestDTO - a PasswordResetRequestDTO object
      Returns:
      JSON response notifying that the password reset is successful or describing the errors
      Throws:
      BasicAuthException
      See Also:
      • PasswordResetRequestDTO

    • getUserSettings

      @GetMapping("user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> getUserSettings(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Returns the account settings of the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      JSON representation of the user

    • postUserSettings

      @PostMapping("user") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> postUserSettings(@Validated(CustomGroupSequence.class) @RequestBody UserSettingsChangeDTO dto, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication) throws BasicAuthException
      Updates the account settings of the currently logged-in user.

      Password, username, and email can be changed. For any of these (old) password should be supplied as well. Changing username or email invalidates existing password reset tokens.
      Parameters:
      dto - user account settings to be updated
      Returns:
      JSON representation of the user
      Throws:
      BasicAuthException - if the update fails
      See Also:
      • UserSettingsChangeDTO
